business.headline: Adani drops Chinese lounge partner DragonPass: What it means for Indian flyersThe move, triggered by rising national security concerns, has ended DragonPass's access to Adani-managed airport lounges across the country.

Why the middle class is chasing expensive brands, explains market expertA market expert noted that nearly 75% of luxury spending today comes from the middle class, not due to rising incomes, but because of social media, marketing tricks, and peer pressure that fuel the urge to appear successful.

Indian traders' body boycotts Turkey and Azerbaijan over support for PakistanThe move comes after both Turkey and Azerbaijan openly showed support for Pakistan, at a time when India is facing sensitive national security challenges.

India-US trade deal: First phase likely to be ready by July 1, say sourcesIndia and the United States are in negotiations for a trade deal, with sources indicating that phase one could be ready by July 1st.

India to grow at 6.3%, ahead of China, US, and European Union: UN reportAccording to the UN's mid-year update of the World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP), India's growth is being fuelled by strong household spending and solid government investments.

Sensex slips 200 points, Nifty holds ground above 25,000; defence stocks surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 200.15 points to close at 82,330.59, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.30 points to end at 25,019.80.

2 IPOs to open next week: Check Belrise Industries, Borana Weaves detailsWhile Belrise Industries will open for bidding on May 21, investors can bid for the IPO of Borana Weaves starting May 20, 2025.

ITR filing 2025: Is July 31 your tax deadline? Find outFiling your return on time helps avoid penalties and delays in refunds. It also keeps your financial records in order. So, if your deadline is July 31, skip the last-minute rush and file in advance.

ITR filing 2025: Is digital Form 16 a game-changer for salaried taxpayers?Digital Form 16 is an electronic version of the traditional Form 16. It's generated directly from the TRACES portal, which is managed by the Income Tax Department. This means all your salary details, TDS, and tax-saving deductions are recorded accurately and match what the government sees.

Government clears 187 startups for tax relief. Here's what it meansTo qualify, the start-up must be recognised by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT). It should be a private limited company or a limited liability partnership and its turnover should not cross Rs 100 crore in any year since incorporation.

What Pakistan can and can't do with IMF loanThe International Monetary Fund (IMF) has approved a fresh loan package for Pakistan, agreeing to release USD 1 billion under its Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

Defence stocks extend rally on possible budget boost. What should investors do?The NSE Nifty India Defence index surged over 5% intraday on Friday. Cochin Shipyard and GRSE have been leading the charge, with the latter gaining a stunning 30% since May 13.

entertainment.headline: Mission Impossible 8 review: Tom Cruise covers gaps with smashing action stuntsReleased-Sat May 17, 2025Tom Cruise once again dazzles with breathtaking stunts and nostalgia in 'Mission Impossible: The Final Reckoning', proving his unmatched dedication to action cinema. Despite some narrative flaws, the film stands out for its thrilling sequences and Cruise's charisma, even at 62.

It's Okay to Not be Okay to Doctor Slump: Evolution of mental health portrayalK-dramas have evolved significantly in portraying mental health, moving from stigma and stereotypes to nuanced and empathetic storytelling. These dramas now highlight real struggles like trauma, anxiety, and burnout, encouraging open conversations about mental well-being.

Kunal Kohli says Saif did Hum Tum after 3 top stars rejected the classicDirector Kunal Kohli revealed that 'Hum Tum' was originally offered to Hrithik Roshan, Aamir Khan, and Vivek Oberoi before Saif Ali Khan landed the role. The iconic romantic comedy re-released in theatres on May 16.

Parul Gulati reacts to claims that Indian actors 'pay' to be at CannesActor Parul Gulati reacted to Cannes banning 'naked' dressing as she is set to make her debut at the prestigious festival. The actor stated that she did not want to feel pressured by it.
Ironheart trailer: Riri Williams takes forward Tony Stark's Iron Man legacyRiri Williams, played by Dominique Thorne, takes forward Iron Man's legacy in the MCU's 'Ironheart' as a genius inventor.

Rani Mukerji as Suhana Khan's mother in Shah Rukh Khan-Deepika's King: ReportRani Mukerji is set to reunite with Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone in Siddharth Anand's upcoming action-thriller 'King', playing a pivotal cameo role. The film begins shooting this month and is slated for a late 2026 release.

Justin Bieber's team addresses rumours of being Sean Diddy's assault victimJustin Bieber's team recently addressed rumours about being sexually assaulted by Sean 'Diddy' Combs.  They mentioned how 'nothing untoward' happened between them.

Pawan Kalyan's Hari Hara Veera Mallu gets release date after multiple delaysAfter several delays, Pawan Kalyan's long-anticipated historical action film, 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu: Part 1 – Sword vs Spirit', is finally gearing up for release on June 12.

Singer Amaal Mallik's family is 'closer, happier' after his decision to break tiesMusic composer Amaal Mallik recently opened up about his battle with depression and the emotional post where he distanced himself from his family. The singer shared that while it initially hurt, his distance has brought his family closer together.

Anaganaga review: A decent film about life beyond marksReleased-Fri May 16, 2025Anaganaga movie review: This Telugu drama film, starring Sumanth in the lead, keeps a mirror in front of the present education system, and hits the right emotional chords to shine light on the problem and the solution.

Vikrant Massey in Karan Johar's Dostana 2 after Kartik Aaryan's exit: ReportVikrant Massey is rumoured to be replacing Kartik Aaryan in Karan Johar's much-delayed Dostana 2, which is expected to begin shooting in January 2026. The film will also star Lakshya and introduce a fresh female lead.

BTS' Jin shares heartbreak anthem Don't Say You Love Me from album EchoBTS's Jin dropped the new music video for the title track, 'Don't Say You Love Me', featuring actor Shin Se-kyung. The song is a part of his album, 'Echo'.

Assamese singer Gayatri Hazarika dies at 44; Assam mourns a cultural iconAssamese singer Gayatri Hazarika had been battling colon cancer for some time. The popular Assamese icon died at a hospital in Guwahati.

Ajay Devgn-Riteish Deshmukh's Dhamaal 4 gears up for Eid 2026 releaseAjay Devgn's Dhamaal 4 is scheduled to release on Eid 2026. The Indra Kumar-directorial also features Riteish Deshmukh and Arshad Warsi.

Jacqueline Fernandez brings old Hollywood glam to Cannes 2025 in red gown. PicsActor Jacqueline Fernandez walked the red carpet of the Cannes International Film Festival as part of the 'Women in Cinema' gala. The actor looked stunning in her jewelled shirt, and also in her red corset gown.

Kurta-clad Shin Chan will dance to Bollywood songs in upcoming film. DetailsShin Chan's new movie, 'Shin Chan: The Spicy Kasukabe Dancers', will be released in theatres in India this October. Our favourite troublemaker is coming back in a desi avatar.

Love you puttar: Sham Kaushal's note for Vicky, brother Sunny sends wishesVicky Kaushal's father, Sham, extended his birthday wishes to his son with a heartfelt note. The actor's brother, Sunny Kaushal, also sent his love.

Samantha consoles emotional crew member at Subham event, fans call her 'gold'Actor Samantha often wins hearts on the internet with her thoughtful gestures. In yet another touching moment captured at the success bash of 'Subham', she was seen consoling an emotional crew member while addressing the media on stage.

My body is filling out: Ananya Panday shuts down 'getting butt done' rumoursAnanya Panday commented on being subjected to body-shaming. The actor addressed the rumours of getting buttock enhancement surgery done in an interview with Lilly Singh.

general news.headline: Asim Munir woke me up at 2.30 am: Pak PM confirms India strikes on key airbasesIndia conducted precision strikes on Pakistani military sites, including Nur Khan Air Base, on May 10 as part of Operation Sindoor. The strikes were in retaliation to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, in which 26 people were killed.

Akashteer, BrahMos: Weapons of war behind Operation Sindoor successOperation Sindoor marked one of the most aggressive responses by India in decades, and it sent a clear message to a neighbour often accused of harbouring terror.

Relief, then fire: Neeraj Chopra's 90m breakthrough lights a fresh fuseAfter years of near misses, Neeraj Chopra finally broke the elusive 90-metre barrier in the Doha Diamond League on Friday, marking a historic milestone. Yet, with fierce rivals rising, this breakthrough signals just the beginning of a new, fiercer battle ahead.

Beneath the blue: India's Samudrayaan dives into the unknownThe vast open seas harbour some of the most pristine, untouched environments and precious resources that remain hidden from the clutches of man.

Mission Impossible 8 review: Tom Cruise covers gaps with smashing action stuntsReleased-Sat May 17, 2025Tom Cruise once again dazzles with breathtaking stunts and nostalgia in 'Mission Impossible: The Final Reckoning', proving his unmatched dedication to action cinema. Despite some narrative flaws, the film stands out for its thrilling sequences and Cruise's charisma, even at 62.

News Menu, May 17: Piyush Goyal in US for trade talks; IPL returnsFrom the resumption of the IPL and Rajnath Singh's Operation Sindoor warnings to BRICS boycott calls and Prashant Kishor's Bihar rebellion, India Today's news platter serves a fiery mix of geopolitics, sports, and local churn.

US considering reality TV show for immigrants to compete for citizenshipThe US is exploring a reality TV show where immigrants compete to win citizenship as the prize. This new concept aims to combine entertainment with immigration opportunities.

Video: Israel pounds Houthi strongholds in Yemen, 2 major ports hit in airstrikesIsrael attacked Yemen's Hodeidah and Salif ports targeting Houthi military sites and warned that leader Abdul Malik al-Houthi could be targeted if attacks continue.

The real star in Netflix's 'The Royals'? Kavya Trehan's edgy wardrobeNeither Bhumi Pednekar nor Zeenat Aman - it's Kavya Trehan's Jinnie who emerges as the surprising fashion icon of The Royals, serving bold, eclectic, and culturally rooted looks that steal the spotlight.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Turkey's Celebi sues India for revoking security clearance amid Pak conflictCelebi Airport Services India, in a May 16 filing seen by Reuters, asked the Delhi High Court to set aside that decision, arguing it would impact 3,791 jobs and investor confidence.

US planning to permanently relocate 1 million Palestinians to Libya: ReportThe Trump administration is considering relocating up to 1 million Palestinians from Gaza to Libya in exchange for unfreezing Libyan funds, according to a report by NBC News. However, the US government has denied the claim.

India's burden has reduced: Neeraj Chopra on breaching 90m markNeeraj Chopra threw a personal best of 90.23m at the Doha Diamond League, breaking the 90m barrier. Neeraj said that the monkey was off the shoulders for many Indian fans who thought that he would not be able to breach the 90m mark.

Despite widespread condemnation, why is BJP not taking action against Vijay Shah?At a recent event, Vijay Shah said that the Prime Minister had sent a "sister from the same community" as those in Pakistan to avenge the April 22 terror attack in Kashmir's Pahalgam.

Satellites perfectly assisted forces to shoot down Pak drones, missiles: IsroOn the nights of May 9 and 10, Akashteer, India's advanced air defence system, along with the Russian-imported S-400, emerged as an invisible shield, intercepting and neutralising Pakistani air attacks on Indian civilians and military locations.

Adani drops Chinese lounge partner DragonPass: What it means for Indian flyersThe move, triggered by rising national security concerns, has ended DragonPass's access to Adani-managed airport lounges across the country.

Chinnaswamy awaits Virat Kohli magic in first match after Test retirementIPL 2025, RCB vs KKR: Royal Challengers Bengaluru have a great chance of becoming the first team to qualify for the playoffs when they meet Kolkata Knight Riders on May 17 at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Omar Abdullah vs Mehbooba Mufti over water project after India pauses Indus treatyWhile Omar Abdullah has advocated for the revival of the Tulbul project after India suspended the Indus Waters Treaty with Pakistan, Mehbooba Mufti labelled his suggestion "deeply unfortunate" and "dangerously provocative".

India to grow at 6.3%, ahead of China, US, and European Union: UN reportAccording to the UN's mid-year update of the World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP), India's growth is being fuelled by strong household spending and solid government investments.

India's war hero who created a graveyard of Pak's Patton tanks with a gunThe 1965 Indo-Pak War saw the biggest tank battle since World War II. Indian Army Havildar Abdul Hamid drove around in a jeep, mounted with a recoilless gun, through sugarcane fields, destroying Pakistan's US-made Patton tanks. Hamid destroyed up to 12 tanks and laid his life in the line of duty. He was awarded the Param Vir Chakra, India's highest wartime gallantry award.

Spectacular feat, India is proud: PM praises Neeraj Chopra after 90.23 metres throwPrime Minister Narendra Modi praised Neeraj Chopra's historic 90.23m throw at the Doha Diamond League, celebrating his first-ever 90-meter milestone and applauding his dedication to this historic feat.

Trump to release Biden interview audio showing verbal stumbles, memory lapseThe audio recording of the interview, previously blocked by the White House, is now set to be released by the Trump administration amid renewed scrutiny of Biden's memory and fitness for office following his withdrawal from the 2024 race.

Neeraj Chopra throws record 90.23m, but finishes 2nd in Doha Diamond LeagueNeeraj Chopra finished in second place in the 2025 Doha Diamond League Men's Javelin Throw event on Friday (May 16), despite a record-breaking 90.23-meter throw, as Germany's Julian Weber startled everyone with a final throw of 91.06 meters.

sports.headline: Relief, then fire: Neeraj Chopra's 90m breakthrough lights a fresh fuseAfter years of near misses, Neeraj Chopra finally broke the elusive 90-metre barrier in the Doha Diamond League on Friday, marking a historic milestone. Yet, with fierce rivals rising, this breakthrough signals just the beginning of a new, fiercer battle ahead.

Roston Chase replaces Kraigg Brathwaite as new West Indies Test captainRoston Chase has been named the new West Indies Test captain, stepping into the role after Kraigg Brathwaite's resignation, as the team prepares to host Australia in their opening World Test Championship series.

Spectacular feat, India is proud: PM praises Neeraj Chopra after 90.23 metres throwPrime Minister Narendra Modi praised Neeraj Chopra's historic 90.23m throw at the Doha Diamond League, celebrating his first-ever 90-meter milestone and applauding his dedication to this historic feat.

Jannik Sinner sets up blockbuster Carlos Alcaraz final after huge scare in semisItalian Open 2025: Jannik Sinner is set to face Carlos Alcaraz after beating Tommy Paul in the semi-final. Sinner became the first Italian to play in the Rome final since 1978.

'Mentally stronger' Sneh Rana eyes World Cup after record-breaking returnIn an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, Sneh Rana spoke about her incredible ODI comeback in the Sri Lanka tri-nation series where she picked up 15 wickets and won the Player of the Series award. On Thursday, Rana also found her way back into India's T20I team for the tour of England.

Chinnaswamy awaits Virat Kohli magic in first match after Test retirementIPL 2025, RCB vs KKR: Royal Challengers Bengaluru have a great chance of becoming the first team to qualify for the playoffs when they meet Kolkata Knight Riders on May 17 at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

In stats: Neeraj Chopra becomes 25th man to join elite 90m club in javelinNeeraj Chopra finally breached the elusive 90m barrier with a throw of 90.23m, becoming the 25th athlete in the world — and only the third Asian — to achieve the feat in the men's javelin throw.

Parul Chaudhary betters steeplechase national record, qualifies for World ChampionshipIndian steeplechaser Parul Chaudhary made a powerful start to her 2025 season, smashing her own national record in the women's 3000m steeplechase with a time of 9:13.39 at the Doha Diamond League on Friday

Watch: Neeraj Chopra's subdued celebration after historic 90.23 metres throwNeeraj Chopra became the first Indian to cross the 90m mark in men's javelin with a 90.23m throw at the 2025 Doha Diamond League. This milestone ends years of pressure and sets a new benchmark despite a narrow defeat to Julian Weber.

KKR has nothing much to lose from here: Manish Pandey ahead of RCB clashKKR batter Manish Pandey has said that the team has nothing much to lose now in the IPL 2025 season and will be aiming for a strong finish to the campaign. KKR will face RCB on May 17 as the IPL campaign restarts.

In stats: Neeraj Chopra becomes 25th man to join elite 90m club in javelinNeeraj Chopra finally breached the elusive 90m barrier with a throw of 90.23m, becoming the 25th athlete in the world — and only the third Asian — to achieve the feat in the men's javelin throw.

Parul Chaudhary betters steeplechase national record, qualifies for World ChampionshipIndian steeplechaser Parul Chaudhary made a powerful start to her 2025 season, smashing her own national record in the women's 3000m steeplechase with a time of 9:13.39 at the Doha Diamond League on Friday

This milestone ends years of pressure and sets a new benchmark despite a narrow defeat to Julian Weber.

KKR has nothing much to lose from here: Manish Pandey ahead of RCB clashKKR batter Manish Pandey has said that the team has nothing much to lose now in the IPL 2025 season and will be aiming for a strong finish to the campaign. KKR will face RCB on May 17 as the IPL campaign restarts.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
